contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} '''''The Starr Affair''''' was a book written by [[Jean Overton Fuller]] and published in 1954 by [[Victor Gollancz]]. It tells the story [[John Renshaw Starr]], an officer of the British [[Special Operations Executive]] sent to establish the [[Acrobat Network]] in north-eastern [[France]] during the [[Second World War]]. Subsequently captured, tortured and imprisoned in [[Fresnes prison]], at [[84 Avenue Foch]] and in [[Sachsenhausen concentration camp|Sachsenhausen]] and [[Mauthausen concentration camp|Mauthausen]] concentration camps. It is based on the subject's own account of his activities, captivity and survival and the subsequent investigations concerning his suspected collaboration with the enemy. {{DEFAULTSORT:Starr Affair, The}} [[Category:1954 novels]] [[Category:World War II novels]] {{War-novel-stub}}
